Title: OKTA unit
Description: A unit of measurement of the cloudiness expressed in OKTA or OCTA, i.e. A unit of count defining the number of eighth-parts as a measure of the celestial dome cloud coverage.

Title: gigawatt
Description: GW unit as per UN/CEFACT recommendation 20.

Title: hectopascal
Description: A unit of measurement of the pressure expressed in hectopascal.

Title: ampere
Description: The unit of electrical current in the International system of Units (SI) equivalent to one Coulomb per second.

Title: One
Description: A unit for dimensionless quantities, also called quantities of dimension one.

Title: Celsius
Description: A unit of measurement of temperature expressed in degree Celsius.

Title: watt per square meter
Description: A unit of measurement of the density of heat flow rate expressed in watt per square meter.

Title: degree (unit of angle)
Description: A unit of measurement of angles expressed in a 0 to 360 degree gradient.

Title: Megawatt per Hertz
Description: A unit of energy expressed as the load change in million watts that will cause a frequency shift of one hertz.

Title: gigawatt hour
Description: GWh unit as per UN/CEFACT recommendation 20.

Title: cubic hectometres
Description: A unit of volume equal to one million cubic metres.

Title: Hertz
Description: HTZ unit as per UN/CEFACT recommendation 20.

Title: K (Kelvin)
Description: Temperature unit refer ISO 80000-5 (Quantities and units, Part 5: Thermodynamics).

Title: kilometre
Description: km unit as per UN/CEFACT recommendation 20.

Title: kilovolt ampere reactive
Description: A unit of electrical reactive power represented by a current of one thousand amperes flowing due to a potential difference of one thousand volts where the sine of the phase angle between them is 1. The unity power factor is expressed in thousands of a volt ampere reactive.

Title: kilovolt
Description: kV unit as per UN/CEFACT recommendation 20.

Title: kilowatt hour
Description: A total amount of electrical energy transferred or consumed in one hour.

Title: kilowatt
Description: A unit of bulk power flow, which can be defined as the rate of energy transfer /consumption when a current of 1000 amperes flows due to a potential of 1000 volts at unity power factor expressed in thousands of a watt.

Title: megavolt ampere reactive hours
Description: Total amount of reactive power across a power system.

Title: megavolt ampere reactive
Description: A unit of electrical reactive power represented by a current of one thousand amperes flowing due to a potential difference of one thousand volts where the sine of the phase angle between them is 1.

Title: megawatt
Description: A unit of bulk power flow, which can be defined as the rate of energy transfer /consumption when a current of 1000 amperes flows due to a potential of 1000 volts at unity power factor expressed in millions of a watt.

Title: minute
Description: A period of time equal to sixty seconds.

Title: millimeter
Description: A unit of measurement of length expressed in millimeter.

Title: cubic metres per second
Description: The volume flow rate of cubic metre per second.

Title: cubic metre
Description: A Cubic metre.

Title: metre
Description: The length of a metre.

Title: meter per second
Description: A unit of measurement of the speed expressed in m/s.

Title: millihertz
Description: A unit of frequency equal to 0.001 cycle per second.

Title: megavolt-ampere
Description: MVA unit as per UN/CEFACT recommendation 20.

Title: megawatt hours
Description: The total amount of bulk energy transferred or consumed.

Title: percent
Description: A unit of proportion equal to 0.01.

Title: second
Description: A period of time equal to one second.

Title: watt
Description: The watt is the International System of Units (SI) standard unit of power (energy per unit time), the equivalent of one joule per second.
